tweet: This week, .@RepHartzler and I wrote a letter to President Trump urging action to bring pharmaceutical manufacturing and its supply chain back to the United States.

Our nation’s nurses have shown us what true dedication, compassion & hard work mean. During this time of crisis, we must give thanks by ensuring they have the necessary equipment to keep themselves safe. On this #NationalNursesWeek, I thank the nurses who protect our communities. https://t.co/hmsYGMgqUz

I will be hosting a telephone town hall with local health and employment experts on May 5 at 3:00 p.m. PST to discuss the ongoing health pandemic and how to access resources.

THREAD: The U.S.S. Roosevelt is a very sick ship that needs leadership that the crew believes in and trusts. The Navy’s leadership has conducted an initial review and recommended Captain Crozier be reinstated. It’s time for Crozier to return and bring his ship back to health.

Sadly, 11 members of our community at a skilled nursing facility in Woodland have died due to complications with COVID-19. My heart is with them and their loved ones as they deal with this unthinkable loss.
Last month, I worked with @RepThompson to write a letter to Administrator Buzby supporting the Mare Island Dry Dock’s (MIDD) application for the Small Shipyard Grant Program.
Today we remember and mourn the victims of the Armenian genocide as we mark Armenian Genocide Remembrance Day.

THREAD: The Navy made the right decision in recommending Brett Crozier be reinstated as Captain of the U.S.S. Roosevelt. Captain Crozier is a man of incredible integrity and is respected by the sailors aboard the U.S.S. Roosevelt.
